newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU parliament can't hold EMU budget pact hostage-EU.
newsitem.headline: EU parliament can't hold EMU budget pact hostage-EU.

text.p: European Union officials on Friday dismissed reports suggesting that the European Parliament might hold up agreement on a budget stability pact for countries joining a single currency.
"It's complete rubbish," said one EU diplomat.
Diplomats said the parliament offered its views of the pact on May 29, a move that now prevents it from further altering the details of the accord.

The so-called stability and growth pact, designed to curb excessive spending by countries inside EMU, was largely agreed at the last EU summit in December in Dublin. Several details, such as the distribution of fines collected from governments with high deficits, were still unresolved.

EU diplomats noted that some of the parliament's proposals were "taken into consideration". But the pact, which includes two EU regulations and a political resolution, could not be held up by the parliament.
"The stability pact is even more stable now because it's been accepted by the European Parliament," said another diplomat.
